Jubilation as Liverpool win Premier League to end 30-year drought|26/06/2020|"Jubilation as Liverpool win Premier League to end 30-year drought
Liverpool ended a 30-year wait for the English title as they were crowned Premier League champions on Thursday
column2: triggering jubilant scenes as fans ignored social-distancing to celebrate uproariously.

column1: Jurgen Klopps men sealed a 19th league title with a record seven games remaining after Chelseas 2-1 defeat of second-placed Manchester City left the 2018 and 2019 champions an unbridgeable 23 points adrift.
Liverpools first English title since 1990 -- further delayed by the coronavirus shutdown -- earns them their maiden trophy in the Premier League
column2: which was introduced in 1992 and has been won 13 times by their arch-rivals Manchester United.

column1: Klopp was in tears after Liverpools long-awaited win
column2: which follows their Champions League and Club World Cup victories last year
column3: when they finished just a point behind City in the Premier League.

column1: Its such a big moment
column2: I am completely overwhelmed
column3: an emotional Klopp told Sky Sports. Tonight it is for you out there.

column1: Its incredible. I hope you stay at home
column2: or go in front of your house if you want
column3: but not more. We do it together in this moment and it is a joy to do it for you.

column1: However
column2: thousands of fans
column6: chanting and celebrating with a replica trophy
column7: while motorists drove up and beeped their horns.

column1: Congratulations poured in from around the world with basketball star LeBron James
column2: actor Samuel L. Jackson and former world number one tennis player Caroline Wozniacki among those paying tribute.

column1: - Im hoping there is more -
Liverpool
column2: who were tantalisingly close to glory when the coronavirus forced the suspension of English football in March
column3: demolished Crystal Palace 4-0 at their home ground of Anfield on Wednesday to stand on the brink of the title.

column1: City needed to win at Stamford Bridge to keep the Premier League alive but slipped to a 2-1 defeat.
Liverpools 19th English title
column2: which puts them one behind Uniteds record haul of 20
column3: owes much to the transformational impact of Klopp.

column1: We followed him and believed him
column2: said captain Jordan Henderson. Its been an amazing journey.

column1: Im hoping there is more. We just keep hungry
column2: keep wanting more and following him.

column1: Liverpool have clinched the title earlier than any other Premier League champions
column2: breaking the previous record of five games left shared by City and Manchester United.

column1: But it has been an agonising wait for Liverpool fans across the world
column2: with the coronavirus lockdown forcing them to put the champagne on ice.

column1: Videos on social media showed many of Liverpools players watching the Chelsea match together at a hotel.
We wont tell you the exact location but we are all in a hotel together as a team
column2: Liverpool star Andrew Robertson told the BBC.

column1: We thought something hopefully special was going to happen and thats how it turned out.
- Ferguson era -
Liverpool spent years in the shadow of arch-rivals Manchester United during the Alex Ferguson era before being left behind by the massive spending of Manchester City and Chelsea.
They infamously squandered a golden opportunity to win the title in 2014 under manager Brendan Rodgers
column2: when Reds captain Steven Gerrard made a costly slip in a late-season defeat against Chelsea.

column1: But Klopps team are deserved champions after an incredible campaign that could end in record-breaking style.
Liverpool are on course to beat Manchester Citys record points total of 100 set in 2017/18.
Klopp
column2: the first German manager to win the Premier League
column3: has been the architect of Liverpools renaissance since the former Borussia Dortmund boss arrived in 2015.

column1: Infusing his players with a belief in his heavy metal football and high-tempo gegen-pressing game-plan
column2: the charismatic Klopp has earned his place alongside Liverpools iconic former managers Bill Shankly

column1: He epitomises everything that Liverpool Football Club stands for. He appreciates it
column2: he respects everyone who works at he club

column1: Klopp led the club to the Champions League last season
column2: but Liverpool were pipped to the Premier League title by City despite finishing with a record 97 points for top-flight runners-up.

column1: But with Mohamed Salah
column2: Sadio Mane and Roberto Firmino forming a formidable front three
column3: Henderson a tireless presence in midfield and Virgil van Dijk imperious at the back
column4: Liverpool have left City trailing in their wake this term.

column1: That is the reality
column2: that we are so far behind
column3: said City boss Pep Guardiola. Liverpool were fantastic in consistency throughout the whole season."|https://nairobinews.nation.co.ke/amp/editors-picks/jubilation-as-liverpool-win-premier-league-to-end-30-year-drought

column1: Wanga ends goal-scoring drought for Azam|02/03/2016|"Wanga ends goal-scoring drought for Azam
Allan Wanga (right) in action for Azam during a Tanzanian domestic cup match against FC Panone.
Harambee Stars striker Allan Wanga says he wants to bang in more goals after ending a three-month scoring drought for his Tanzanian club Azam on Monday.
Wanga scored Azams winning goal in a 2-1 victory over FC Panone in a domestic cup round of 16 match in Moshi.

Staying for that long without scoring obviously affects any striker. I am now in the mood to bang in more goals and help the club win the championship this season. I wish to thank the technical bench for retaining the faith in me
column2: the former El Merreikh striker told azamfc.co.tz.

column1: Wangas all round performances in the match earned praised from coach Stewart Hall. The forward is now well-placed to start the clubs forthcoming assignments against Yanga SC in the league before taking on South African side Bidvest Wits in the Caf Africa Confederation Cup.
Besides Wanga
column2: the other forwards in the clubs potent strike force are Ivorian Kipre Tchetche
column3: Burundi sensation Didier Kavumbaga and local boy John Bocco.

column1: Azam
column2: which defeated Gor Mahia to win the Cecafa Club Championship in Tanzania last year
column3: are also considered favourite to win the league title this term."|https://nairobinews.nation.co.ke/amp/sports/wanga-ends-goal-scoring-drought-azam
